page.title: 04Cheadle High St. (Shops)
page.content: We surveyed the majority of shops in Cheadle High St. which amounted to about 50.Most of the shops were more than 50 yrs. old and many had changed hands & uses over the yrs.Most owners knew the age & previous history of their shops.Miss Salt's Wool Shop had belonged to the same family for 100 yrs.It is still in use as a wool shop & has changed very little. The original shop fittings are still in use.Most customers live locally and Friday & Saturday are the busiest days of the week.Most shops employed very few staff (between 1-5).The Co-op was the largest employer with 20-30 staff. Many shops had part time assistants. There were 169 women & 116 men working in the shops.The majority of the shops were small family concerns providing a personal service to the public.
